User Provided Components

In order for GTk to recognize gestures, it must first be trained on known data. This training data, and later, data to be interpreted as gestures, must be provided by the user. Once GTk is trained, it will perform gesture recognition. The results can then be acted on by the application designer. In order for GTk to best use the input data, it should be processed to find salient characteristics, or features. An example feature is the size and shape of a ball being tracked by a camera.


Debian User 2003-12-13
